bucket_access_restricted.title: Backblaze bucket access restricted
bucket_access_restricted.description:
Access to your Backblaze bucket {bucket_name} is restricted for the current credentials. This means your application key may only have access to specific buckets, but not this one. To fix this issue:

1. Log in to your Backblaze account
2. Check your application key restrictions
3. Either use a different bucket that your key can access, or create a new application key with access to {bucket_name}
4. Go to Settings > Devices & Services > Backblaze and reconfigure the integration settings

Once you update the integration settings, this issue will be automatically resolved.

bucket_not_found.title: Backblaze bucket not found
bucket_not_found.description:
The Backblaze bucket {bucket_name} cannot be found or accessed. This could mean:

1. The bucket was deleted
2. The bucket name was changed
3. Your credentials no longer have access to this bucket

To fix this issue:

1. Log in to your Backblaze account
2. Verify the bucket still exists and check its name
3. Ensure your application key has access to this bucket
4. Go to Settings > Devices & Services > Backblaze and reconfigure the integration settings

Once you update the integration settings, this issue will be automatically resolved.
